Package ausroulette.model

Class PlayerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • ausroulette.model.PlayerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Player, java.lang.Comparable<Player>
    public class PlayerImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Player
    A concrete representation of a player in the Aussie Roulette game in the Further Programming Assignment

    This implements the interface Player.

    Each player has an id and a name, both of which cannot be changed once assigned. The player has points which is used in placing bets within the game. The initial points are supplied at creation, and also cannot change, but are used as the starting point for points that can and do thought the course of the game.

    Author:
    Ross Nye
    See Also:
    GameEngine, GameEngine.addPlayer(String, String, int)

        public PlayerImpl​(java.lang.String id,

                  int initialPoints)

        Parameters:
        id - the id of the player
        name - the name of the player
        initialPoints - the initial points the player should start with
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if supplied id or name are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases
        • supplied id is an empty String
        • supplied name is an empty String
        • supplied intialPoints is not a positive number

      • applyBetOutcome

        public void applyBetOutcome​(Bet bet)
        Description copied from interface: Player
        Applies the supplied finalised bet outcome within this player.

        Takes a bet finalised at the completion on the spin and applies changes to the player's point, current bet total, and available points. The Bet is also no longer stored by the Player.

        Note: Bet amounts are not actually deducted from the player's point's balance until a bet is lost and finalised. When bet is won the amount bet becomes available again and the points balance is increased by the amount won from a bet.

        e.g. Winning a 1 Red color bet, the bet amount (1) becomes available again and the points balance is also increased by the win amount (1). The overall result is that the balance is increased by one.

        Specified by:
        applyBetOutcome in interface Player
        Parameters:
        bet - the bet to be finalised
        See Also:
        Bet.finaliseBet(ausroulette.model.wheel.Pocket), GameEngine.applyWinLoss(int, ausroulette.model.wheel.Pocket)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from interface: Player
        Generates a String representation of the pocket as seen in the supplied .log file.

        The String must match exactly the expected String. This will be tested during marking.

        Examples: 

         Player ID: "P1", Name: "Mr Dollarbucks"
 Points: 100, Available Points: 84
 Current Bets: 2, Total Bet: 16
 
         Player ID: "P2", Name: "Bingo"
 Points: 38, Available Points: 38
 Current Bets: 0, Total Bet: 0
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Player
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representing the player
